Title:
A phylogenetic assessment and taxonomic revision of
thermotolerant genera Acrophialophora and Taifanglania
Abstract:
This study assessed the phylogenetic relationships of 19
isolates belonging to Acrophialophora and Taifanglania based on internal
transcribed spacer (ITS), and small subunit (SSU) rDNA and Î²-tubulin
sequences. The phylogenetic data showed that Acrophialophora and
Taifanglania together constitute a monophyletic clade, but did not
support the separation of two genera. Being the older and more
frequently used name, Acrophialophora is adopted as the generic name.
Taifanglania is treated as a later synonym of Acrophialophora. The
generic concept of Acrophialophora is updated. In addition, three new
thermotolerant species isolated from soil samples in China were
described and illustrated in this paper. A. ellipsoidea sp. nov. is
characterized by solitary phialides tapering into thin necks, and
ellipsoidal to fusiform conidia formed in long chains. A. angustiphialis
sp. nov. is characterized by single phialides on tip or lateral of
hyphae, and ellipsoidal or fusiform conidia. A. acuticonidiata sp. nov.
is characterized by single phialides and fusiform conidia with prominent
tips at each end. Phylogenetic analyses show that A. acuticonidiata , A.
angustiphialis and A. ellipsoidea are most closely related to A.
curticatenata, A. hechuanensis and A. major, respectively. The
temperature test showed that the three new species are thermotolerant,
with optimal growth temperature between 37 Â°C and 40 Â°C, and maximum
growth temperature near 50 Â°C. A key to the accepted species in
Acrophialophora is provided.
